cnbc.summary: Berkshire's operating profit dipped 4% year over year to $11.16 billion in the second quarter.

cnbc.title: Ethereum turns 10: From scrappy experiment to Wall Street’s invisible backbone
cnbc.summary: Once dismissed as a side project to bitcoin, the blockchain now powers stablecoins, tokenized assets, and the payment rails of major banks.

cnbc.title: Trump fires commissioner of labor statistics after weaker-than-expected jobs figures slam markets
cnbc.summary: Trump accused BLS Commissioner Erika McEntarfer of being a political appointee who was manipulating jobs data.

cnbc.summary: Her resignation now paves the way for Trump to put his own nominee in for the Board of Governors.

cnbc.summary: Spicy menu items have gained traction primarily through social media via platforms like TikTok and Instagram.

cnbc.title: 'What am I falling in love with?' Human-AI relationships are no longer just science fiction
cnbc.summary: Since ChatGPT’s late 2022 launch, everyday people have formed emotional connections to chatbots, describing them as deep friendships and even life partnerships.

cnbc.title: Google has dropped more than 50 DEI-related organizations from one of its funding lists
cnbc.summary: The dropped groups had mission statements that included the words "diversity, "equity," "inclusion," or "race," "activism," and "women."

cnbc.title: Here's where the jobs are in this slowing economy
cnbc.summary: July's much weaker-than-expected job growth was supported primarily by the health-care sector, data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics released Friday shows.
